articles.author: Neelakandan R
articles.description:
What is the DOM? The DOM is a programming interface provided by the browser that represents the structure of a web page as a tree of objects. Each element in an HTML document becomes a node (object) in this tree. JavaScript can use the DOM to access and manipulate HTML and CSS. My Page

Hello, DOM!

let heading = document.getElementById("title"); heading.textContent = "Welcome to JavaScript DOM!"; What Does the HTML DOM Look Like? Imagine your webpage as a tree The document is the root. HTML tags like , , and are branches. Attributes, text, and other elements are the leaves. Why is DOM Required? Dynamic Content Updates: Without reloading the page, the DOM allows content updates (e.g‚Ä¶
articles.title: DOM and Array in JavaScript

articles.author: Cesar Aguirre
articles.description:
I originally posted this post on my blog.
Did AI kill the tech interview?
Truth is hiring and interviewing have been broken for years. There wasn't much left to kill.
In over 10 years, I've witnessed all types of interviews: casual conversations, interrogation-like conversations with rapid-fire questions, take-home coding exercises, and the infamous LeetCode exercises.
I asked Phind and Copilot to solve an interview exercise. I might or might not have been asked that exercise when applying to a FAANG.
Here's the "made-up" problem:
You're given a string containing the words "one" and "two", and the symbols "+" and "-" representing a math expression. Write a C# function called "Evaluate" to evaluate that expression after replacing "one" with 1 and "two" with 2. Assume the underlying expressi‚Ä¶
articles.title: I Asked Phind and Copilot to Solve a LeetCode-Like Interview Exercise‚ÄîTheir Solutions Surprised Me

articles.author: Duplessis van Aswegen
articles.description:
It‚Äôs Always the Refund


It started, as these things always do, with a Slack message from support that began:

"This is probably nothing, but‚Ä¶"
It never is.
Turns out a customer had requested a refund for a $0 order‚Äîpaid entirely with a promotional code that someone in marketing named ‚ÄúYOLO100.‚Äù Our system, ever obedient, generated a pristine digital refund for exactly zero currency units and confidently shoved it into the payment gateway, which replied with the transactional equivalent of a raised eyebrow:

"Invalid amount."
From there, the trail of confusion expanded outward like a suburban sprawl. Engineering said it shouldn‚Äôt be possible. QA said it wasn‚Äôt in the test cases. Product said it was ‚Äúan edge case.‚Äù (They always say that, don‚Äôt they? Every single cliff we fall off was once c‚Ä¶
articles.title: The Abstraction That Hid the Only Logic That Mattered

articles.author: Freecodingboss
articles.description:
Why RWAs aren‚Äôt the decentralized revolution you think they are
Tokenized real-world assets (RWAs) are the new crypto darling.
Everyone‚Äôs hyped: BlackRock‚Äôs onchain, treasuries are getting wrapped, and traditional finance is flirting hard with blockchain.
But let‚Äôs not get it twisted: RWAs aren‚Äôt decentralization. They‚Äôre TradFi in a blockchain costume.
Here‚Äôs the inconvenient truth:
Want to buy tokenized real estate? Great. But that token doesn‚Äôt give you squat unless a legal entity off-chain honors it.
Treasury tokens? Same thing. You‚Äôre trusting a fund manager, custodian, or regulatory body to redeem it.
It‚Äôs not trustless. It‚Äôs regulatory theater with a smart contract backend.
RWAs are less about empowering users and more about navigating global compliance.
It‚Äôs not about breaking the system. It‚Äôs about bending the rules just enough to extract value while pretending to be futuristic.
This isn‚Äôt DeFi. It‚Äôs just TradFi with faster accounting.
Let‚Äôs be honest: most RWA projects don‚Äôt need a blockchain. They use it for:
Token issuance
Cap table management
Tracking asset flow
But these are things spreadsheets and CRMs have done for decades.
Putting it onchain doesn‚Äôt make it revolutionary ‚Äî it just makes it buzzword-compliant.
Web3 wasn‚Äôt about rehypothecating bonds or making banks more efficient. It was about disintermediation.
Cutting out the middlemen. Giving power back to users. Trustless systems.
RWAs? They reintroduce the middlemen ‚Äî they just wear hoodies now.
Tokenized RWAs sound sexy, but they‚Äôre just Wall Street playing dress-up in Web3.
Until these assets are truly decentralized ‚Äî not just onchain ‚Äî they‚Äôll remain more TradFi than DeFi.
articles.title: Tokenizing Real-World Assets Is Just Wall Street Cosplaying Crypto

articles.author: yaseen ramzan
articles.description:
What is Number Book Saudia?


Number Book Saudia is an online directory and search tool that allows users to look up phone numbers, identify callers, and access business contact information within Saudi Arabia. It serves as a digital phonebook, providing essential details such as the owner's name, location, and service provider.
Identifying unknown callers (spam, telemarketing, or potential fraud)
Verifying business contact details
Checking landline and mobile numbers
Avoiding scams and unwanted calls
Number Book Saudia operates by aggregating publicly available data and user-contributed information to create a searchable database. Here‚Äôs how you can use it:
Enter the Phone Number ‚Äì Users can input a Saudi mobile or landline number into the search bar. Official Website: ŸÜŸÖÿ®ÿ± ÿ®ŸàŸÉ ÿßŸÑÿ≥ÿπŸàÿØŸäÿ©
Search for Details ‚Äì The system scans its database and retrieves available information.
View Results ‚Äì The results may include the caller‚Äôs name, location (city), telecom provider (STC, Mobily, Zain), and user-reported tags (e.g., "Spam" or "Business").
The platform is designed to be user-friendly, ensuring that even those with minimal technical knowledge can easily navigate and retrieve the information they need.
**1. Reverse Phone Lookup
**2. Spam and Fraud Protection
**3. Business Directory
**4. Regular Database Updates
**5. User Privacy Protection
**1. Safety and Security
**2. Convenience for Businesses
**3. Time-Saving
While Number Book Saudia is a powerful tool, there are some limitations:
Not all numbers may be listed, especially private or newly registered ones.
Accuracy depends on user contributions and public data, so some details may be outdated.
Legal restrictions apply to how the data can be used, ensuring compliance with Saudi privacy laws.
Number Book Saudia is an essential tool for anyone living in or doing business in Saudi Arabia. Whether you need to identify an unknown caller, verify a business number, or protect yourself from scams, this platform offers a fast, reliable, and user-friendly solution.
articles.title: Number Book Saudia: Tool Developed Using Python And API

articles.author: Nick Trierweiler
articles.description:
If you are trying to improve local SEO for a small website and read this post, I will save you from reading 3 books, listening to 30 podcast episodes, and reading another 100 blog posts about SEO. 
This year I read a number of great books. About half of them were business related, and the other half development related. 
Among these, I stumbled into a book on SEO. It was great to finally learn about how the internet really functions after being a web developer for 6 years. 
The first thing I learned is that SEO is really Really REALLY complicated. The second thing I learned is that it's complicated because of developers. 
It's our fault because we are so good at automating, scaling, and spamming that is automatable, scalable, and spam-able. If you're a dev reading this right now, you are n‚Ä¶
articles.title: Local SEO is simpler than you think
